author: Staff Reporter
text:
DMK treasurer M.K. Stalin has demanded CBI probe in to the death of ASP Harish, an IPS officer who was found dead in a room inside the police officer’s mess in Chennai, so as to bring out the truth.

Wedding

Mr. Stalin was in Attur in Salem district to participate in the former Minister T.M. Selvaganapathy’s son wedding here on Thursday.

He along with Tamil Nadu Congress Committee president E.V.K.S. Elangovan chaired the stage after both the parties decided to fight the Assembly polls in an alliance.

Addressing the media, Mr. Stalin said that the government is trying to cover-up the death of the officer and said that only a CBI probe would reveal the truth.

He also demanded CBI probe into the alleged suicide of Tiruchengode Division DSP R. Vishnupriya who was found hanging at her quarters in Tiruchengode on September 18, 2015.

“If the government fails to order for CBI probe, we will order for probe after coming to power so that people will know the truth”, he added.

Chairing the stage

He said that after the DMK-Congress alliance was formed recently, this is the first time that leaders of both the parties are chairing the stage. Mr. Elangovan expressed confidence that people will give chance for the collation and they would be in power in another two months.

After both the leaders left the marriage hall, PMK founder S. Ramadoss came to the hall and blessed the couple.

Addressing the media he said that crime rate has gone up and people will teach a lesson to the ruling government in two months.

Employees'

strike

He condemned the State government for being a mute spectator to the ongoing protest by the government employees and said that time has come up for a change.
title: Stalin demands CBI probe into IPS officer’s death
